lines.text: Wait, I remember. I'm with my father, we're lying back in the grass, it's a warm Gallifreyan night...
Gallifreyan?
Gallifrey. Yes, this must be where I live. Now where is that?
I've never heard of it. What do you remember?
A meteor storm. The sky above us was dancing with lights. Purple, green, brilliant yellow. Yes!
What?
These shoes. They fit perfectly!
I finally meet the right guy, and he's from another planet.
I know who I am.
[Kisses Grace]
I am the Doctor.
Good. Now, do that again.
I love humans. They always see patterns in things that aren't there.
Grace, don't you see? I have thirteen lives.
Please! Okay, you're trying to tell me you've come back from the dead.
Yes.
No sorry. The dead stay dead. You can't turn back time.
Yes you can.
I'm not a child, don't talk to me like I'm a child. Only children believe that crap. I am a doctor.
But it was a childish dream that made you a doctor. You dreamed you could hold back death. Isn't that true?
[Grace looks back at the Doctor for a moment, astonished and then begins to walk away]
Don't be sad Grace. You'll do great things.
The world's about to end, and here I am, stuck in traffic.
You have to get me out of here before they kill me again.
[explaining the Doctor's eccentricities]
He's British.
I suppose I am.
[offers a policeman candy]
Jelly baby?
[the Doctor and Grace are saying their final farewell's]
I'm going to miss you.
How can you miss me? I'm easy to find. I'm the guy with two hearts, remember?
That's not what I meant.
Professor Wagg! This is Professor Bowman. He's from London. He was just going to share a secret with us.
Erm, yes professor. Is there a chance of a closer look at the clock.
No! No. I'm afraid I am the the only person allowed up there.
Oh well, can't you bend the rules a little...
No.
Oh but you see...

[Interrupting the Doctor]
Grace says you have a big secret. What is it?

[Taking Professor Wagg to one side]
I'm half human.
[pause as Professor Wagg gives the Doctor an odd look]
On my mothers side.

[standing in front of the open freezer after the Doctor regenerated and walked out]
It wasn't the same guy.
Sounds like you saw the guy stole the body.
He was wearing a shroud and a J.D. tag on his toe.
Somehow, I don't think the Second Coming happens here.
Right. You think he's gonna go to a BETTER HOSPITAL? You know what? I'm going home.
Hey, Pete. Stop by psychiatric and pick up some more mind altering drugs.
Okay, sure.

[Lee and Grace have come back to life]
Well, congratulations. You've both been somewhere I've never been.
It's nothing to be scared of, Doctor.
I'm glad to hear it.

[showing Lee and Grace a view of the universe, the Doctor points to a planet]
Look over there. On the other side of your galaxy. That's home.
Gallifrey!
250 million light years away.
Whoo.
It's a good ten minutes in this old thing.
This looks pretty low tech.
Low tech? Grace, this is a type 40 TARDIS, able to take you to any planet in the universe and to any date in that planet's existence. Temporal physics.
Ohhh. You mean like interdimensional transference. That would explain the spatial displacement we experienced as we passed over the threshold.

[stares at Grace]
... Yes, if you like.
Listen, why don't you just have a seat and open your shirt? I want to listen to your heart.
Hearts. Plural.
Right! Right...
Maybe you have selective amnesia brought on by shock.
Maybe. I don't remember.
[the Doctor and Grace are bickering in the back of an ambulance over the famous people from earths history who he has met. Grace clearly thinks he's mad]

[sarcastically]
I suppose you knew Madame Curie too.
Intimately.
Does she kiss as good as me?
As *well* as you.
That's why there's no time to waste.
But time to change.

[now wearing traditional Time Lord clothing]
I always dress for the occasion.
What are you waiting for?
The road's still blocked.
This is an ambulance!
Oh, right.
[the Doctor pickpockets an obstructive policeman's gun and points it at his own chest]
Now would you stand aside before I shoot myself?

[the Doctor is holding himself at gunpoint]
You with me, Grace?
We don't stand a chance!

[to the policeman]
Would you excuse me, please?
[pulls Grace aside for a conversation while wavering the gun in the policeman's general direction]
Grace, I came back to life. *I* held back death. Look, I can't make your dream come true forever, but I can make it come true *today.*
[about to drive between two closely passing semis]
Breathe in, Grace!
Hey, man, when I get all that gold, you know what I'm gonna do?
I don't want to know.

[laughs]
You kill me.

[puzzled]
You want me to kill you?
No!
[the Doctor is driving crazily through San Francisco, with Grace clinging desperately to his back]
Doctor!
Yes?
I only have one life! Can you remember that?

[grinning happily]
I'll try!
in the fight to survive, there are no rules.

[regarding a young security guard]
His invention saves the human life several times, but first he must graduate in Poetry.
[the Doctor abruptly sets off the fire alarm]
Why'd you do that?
Liven things up! Come on!
The universe hangs by such a delicate thread of coincidences that it would be useless to meddle with it, unless like me you're a Time Lord.
Why a police box?
It's cloaking device got stuck on a previous misadventure.
When he gets his body back from you, I'm gonna be rich.

[incredulously]
And you believe him?
Why shouldn't I?
I suppose he neglected to mention there won't be any place left to *spend* your money!
[the Doctor joins Grace in the lift]
Puccini! We've met before!
Ah, I don't think so.
Yes, yes, yes, I think so! I know you! You're tired of life, but afraid of dying.
[the record player begins to skip]
Oh no, not again!
[first lines]

[voiceover]
It was on the planet Skaro that my old enemy the Master was finally put on trial. They say he listened calmly as his list of evil crimes was read... and sentence passed. Then he made his last and I thought somewhat curious request. He demanded that I, the Doctor, a rival Timelord, should take his remains back to our home planet; Gallifrey
[pause]
It was a request they should never have granted...
[Cue the opening credits]

I do hereby make my last will and testament... If I am to be executed, and thus cruelly deprived of all existence, I ask only that my remains be transported back to my home planet by my rival Time Lord and nemesis - he who calls himself... the Doctor.
Lee is the son I always yearned for.
[hugs Lee and kisses the top of his head]
Oh, PLEASE!
Well? How does it feel? To hold back death?
Where is it? His body.
Well haven't you heard? The body's gone. Stolen!
Okay. Where are his things?
The kid that brought him in ran off with them.
The Asian child.
Tardis? What's a tardis?
A TARDIS is my ship that carries me through Time and Space. T-A-R-D-I-S. It stands for Time And Relative Dimension In Space.

[In pain after being shot]
"Timing malfunction..."
Grace, we don't have time for this! The Eye of Harmony is open; if I don't close it, get my TARDIS and the Master off this planet, *this planet* will no longer exist!

[begins climbing up a ladder to the roof]
You aren't afraid of heights, are you?
Yeah.
So am I.
So, uh, where's the Master?
[the TARDIS gurgles strangely]
Indigestion.
I need the Doctor's body.
Sense of humor, no more snoring... You don't need a doctor. Come back to bed, honey.
My name is not Honey.
Oh well, what would you like me to call you then?
Master will do.
Well, come back to bed, Master.
Bruce, you're sick.
Thank you.
Exterminate! Exterminate!
[the master is disintegrated]
[the Doctor steals an obnoxious policeman's gun and points it at his own chest]
Now would you stand aside before I shoot myself?

[the Doctor is holding himself at gunpoint]
You with me, Grace?
We don't stand a chance!

[to the policeman]
Would you excuse me, please?
[pulls Grace aside while wavering the gun in the policeman's general direction]
I have a horrible feeling we're already too late.
